wikipedia_page.main: Richard Dolman (November 30, 1895 – February 3, 1978) was a British stage and film actor. He worked frequently in musical theatre, appearing in Noël Coward's revue On with the Dance in 1925, and alongside Jessie Matthews in the 1927 revue One Dam Thing After Another. He also featured in Oscar Hammerstein's 1934 musical Three Sisters. Dolman appeared in nine films, often playing romantic leads in releases such as the Ealing Studios comedy Looking on the Bright Side.
